1.text: Remind the people to be submissive to rulers and authorities, to be obedient and ready for every good work,

2.text: not speaking evil of anyone and not contentious. They should also be gentle, showing great humility toward everyone.

3.text: Indeed, we used to be foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving various lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, and hating one another.

4.text: But when the kindness of God our Savior and his love toward mankind appeared,

5.text: (not by works of righteousness which we did ourselves, but according to his mercy), he saved us through the washing of regeneration and renewing of the Holy Spirit.

6.text: Yes, God richly poured out this Spirit on us, through Jesus Christ our Savior,

7.text: so that being justified by his grace, we become heirs according to the hope of eternal life.

8.text: This saying is sure. Concerning these things, I desire that you teach with confidence, so that those who have believed God may be careful to persevere in good works. These things are good and profitable to all.

9.text: Avoid foolish questions, genealogies, dissensions, and disputes about the law. These things are unprofitable and vain.

10.text: After a first and second admonition, have nothing more to do with anyone who causes divisions,

11.text: knowing that such a person is perverted, sinful and self-condemned.

12.text: When I send Artemas to you, or Tychicus, do your utmost to meet me at Nicopolis, for I have determined to spend the winter there.

13.text: Send Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey speedily and see that they lack nothing.

14.text: Make sure that our people also learn to maintain good works to meet urgent needs, so that they may not be unfruitful.

15.text: All who are with me greet you! Greet those who love us in faith. Grace be with you all! Amen.
